channel.title: ::master
channel.description: Hey guys can somebody give me the code for ::master commands on a Pi, also whenever I give somebody donator it gives them mod, when they yell it says donar but idk..

item.title: ::master
item.dc:creator: @Uncalled Uncalled
item.description:
@Uncalled wrote:

I_Hybrid, why would you use the logical equal operator instead of the greater-than equal too operator? It doesn’t make sense to me.

Read full topic

item.title: ::master
item.dc:creator: @GN_Editz GN Editz
item.description:
@GN_Editz wrote:

Just use this command:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("master")) { for (int i = 0; i < 24; i++) { c.playerLevel[i] = 99; c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100); c.getPA().refreshSkill(i); } c.getPA().requestUpdates(); }
[/quote]

How do u do it for a different playerrights?
[/quote]
JUST THIS

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && c.playerRights == 2) { for (int i = 0; i < 24; i++) { c.playerLevel[i] = 99; c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100); c.getPA().refreshSkill(i); } c.getPA().requestUpdates(); }
[/quote]

Thanks Dude - That works

Read full topic

can you just teamview me?

Just use this command:

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("master")) { for (int i = 0; i < 24; i++) { c.playerLevel[i] = 99; c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100); c.getPA().refreshSkill(i); } c.getPA().requestUpdates(); }
[/quote]

How do u do it for a different playerrights?[/quote]
JUST THIS

if (playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("master") && c.playerRights == 2) { for (int i = 0; i < 24; i++) { c.playerLevel[i] = 99; c.playerXP[i] = c.getPA().getXPForLevel(100); c.getPA().refreshSkill(i); } c.getPA().requestUpdates(); }
[/quote]
